item.title: (IND-Pune) Key Account Manager
item.description:
Title: Key Account Manager Location: India-Maharashtra-Pune-India, Pune, Cummins India Ltd Job Number: 130000RE
Responsible for managing the relationship and business strategies for less complex accounts (regional, single business unit, internal, etc.). May have responsibility for larger, more complex accounts when paired with a more senior account manager. Responsibilities include selling the organization's products to assigned business customers to achieve sales goals, expanding existing customer relationships and executing account sales plans in support of business strategy. Develops, manages, and maintains business relationships with assigned accounts supporting the organization's sales strategy. Supports growth or new business opportunities and cost initiatives. Extends and expands sale of products and services to existing clients. Leads, manages and coordinates communication and interfaces with the customer at appropriate levels. Negotiates and implements contracts with accounts as authorized. Manages production and distribution issues associated with accounts. Responsible for establishing and maintaining positive customer relations. Acts as a champion for the voice of the customer within the business. Supports account strategy and works with key stakeholders in the business to achieve optimum results. Responsible for measuring customer satisfaction and creating action plans to improve satisfaction based on data. Manages accounts receivable deliverables including payment terms negotiation discussions. Drives Customer Focus Six Sigma initiatives to strengthen relationship with customer. Drives cross business unit account development in support of account strategy.
Qualifications:
Skills – Leadership:
Ability to create an atmosphere in which timely and high quality information flows smoothly between self and others; encourages the open expression of ideas and opinions Solid understanding of how to think strategically Ability to analyze issues by gathering relevant information systematically and considering a broad range of issues or factors Ability to develop plans that are thorough, realistic, and effective in meeting goals
Skills – Technical:
Ability to effectively and clearly communicate in both written and verbal means Ability to understand and act on financial information Ability to identify and execute the key initiatives to achieve goals with customers and/or channel partners Ability to establish a plan for a call, set call objectives, develop a call strategy, and conduct and close the call. Incorporates Sales Dialogue Skills (Listening and Probing) Ability to assess the support needs of the territory or customer, develop and deliver the training, policies and programs to support them and establishes a communication network Ability to develop rapport, build trust, and create value in relationships with customers and channel partners Ability to understand profitability performance and reasons for variation with appropriate actions to address and ensure maximization of margin across product lines Ability to lead cross-functional teams in implementation of customer or territory projects and improvement activities
Education, Licenses, Certifications
College, university, or equivalent degree in marketing, sales, technical or a related subject or equivalent industry experience required.
Experience
Significant level of relevant work experience, including previous customer and/or product experience required. Purchasing/commercial contract negotiation preferred. Job Field: MARKETING

item.title: (USA-TN-Cookeville) Co-op - Product Validation Engineer (Fall 2013)
item.description:
Title: Co-op - Product Validation Engineer (Fall 2013) Location: United States-Tennessee-Cookeville-US, TN, Cookeville, Fleetguard Other Locations: United States-Wisconsin-Madison-US, WI, Stoughton, FGD Nelson Gusloff Building Job Number: 130000SK
General Job Description
Cummins is a team of dependable, innovative thinkers, who are empowered to generate and deliver solutions for customers, community and environment, and who expect to develop their careers through the challenges only a diverse, Global innovator, can promise.
No, this isn’t one of those ordinary jobs.
Every day, people depend on Cummins to do some extraordinary things in some unusual places. Sometimes we’re under the hood of a truck. Other times we’re using generator exhaust to heat a swimming pool in China. This is a work environment where doing something exceptional and thinking beyond your desk is more than part of the job. It is the job. If you think you’ve never seen a company like Cummins before, just imagine what it’s like to work here.
As a member of our world-class Engineering team, if you are determined to attain the highest levels of professional excellence, Cummins can provide you with the career path and extensive development opportunities you need to achieve your goals.
Advancement with Cummins can take many different and rewarding paths. You may move along a path within one functional discipline or progress along a path that provides experience across a range of functions working with cross-functional teams and rotating to different areas of the company in various positions. Based on performance, business needs and personal interest, employees can cross operating companies, business segments and even geographic boundaries as they advance within our companies.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
- Bachelors or Masters in Mechanical Engineering, Agricultural Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering, or equivalent degree
- Cumulative GPA of 3.0 strongly recommended
- Prior relevant work or internship experience (preferred) Qualifications:
Product Validation Engineer
* Applies basic knowledge of engineering principles and practices to assigned tasks in the design, analysis and release of products and subsystems through the product life cycle. * Assists in creating design specifications considering application, cost, weight, performance, product life, manufacture, assembly and service. * Verifies design using analysis and or functional analysis, interprets results, drives decisions and assesses risk. * Works with other engineering disciplines and cross-functional disciplines to resolve product issues. * Evaluates customer needs and aligns requirements with identified customer expectations. SKILLS
* PC/Internet highly skilled and high communication skills desired. * Basic knowledge in the fundamentals of thermal and fluid sciences, and/or physical chemistry in the specialty of interest * Basic engine/engine systems knowledge * Basic communication skills * Basic teamwork skills BENEFITS / COMPENSATION
Explore superior growth opportunities and enjoy progressive advantages like our 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, stock options, Domestic Partners coverage and a full complement of personal and professional benefits.
Compensation: Base salary commensurate with experience plus bonus.
Please visit careers.cummins.com to learn more about Cummins and apply for opportunities based on your degree program
Cummins Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Affirmative Action Employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace. Job Field: ENGINEERING
Job Type: Cooperative / 12 Month Placement

item.title: (GBR) Sales Manager
item.description:
Title: Sales Manager Location: GB-ENG-London Job Number: LON001052 SALES MANAGER
Situated in vibrant East London, within a beautiful heritage listed building, we carry five stars, and are home to 267 bedrooms, 5 restaurants and bars, 14 private dining & event rooms and a health and fitness centre.
We are looking for a professional self starter who handles working under pressure with experience of identifying, negotiating, securing and driving new business within the corporate sector.
Key responsibilities will include:
· Attracting revenue in line with our strategy and budget

· Implementing sales action plans

· Evening entertainment of key clients x 2 per fortnight minimum
· Attend networking events and trade shows
· Potential sales trips throughout Europe
· Research all existing client companies for further potential business
· To research past clients who no longer actively use the hotel

They will enjoy working closely within a team of Sales Managers and Executives, be presentable and approachable at all times, and have the passion and drive to succeed in a competitive and fast paced environment.
Previous experience in the corporate market is essential.

* 28 days holidays, 30 days after 2 years of service and 33 after 5 years ( 8 Bank Holidays included) * Uniforms * Valet Service * Meals during working hours * Monthly Social Events * New Starters Welcome Drinks * Birthday Drinks * After 6 months of service 1 free night at Andaz Hotel with Breakfast included * After 1 year of service 12 complimentary nights around the world * After 1 year of service possible transfers to other Hyatt Hotels * Cross Trainings * Annual Travel card Loan

item.title: (GBR) Guest Service Officer - Front Office
item.description:
Title: Guest Service Officer - Front Office Location: GB-ENG-London Job Number: LON001050 Hyatt Regency London - The Churchill is an international first class 5* business hotel nestled on the picturesque gardens of Portman Square, London W1, just 100 meters north of Marble Arch.
Innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit are the foundation for the way we conduct business. Our goal is to attract and retain a workforce that is comfortable in working in a luxury hospitality environment, and is motivated to provide a level of service, which is excellent, innovative and customer-driven, and reflects the local cultures where we do business. We believe we can accomplish this by being a "listening" company of well-informed, impassioned people.
The duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Ensure all guests are greeted at all times in a charming and helpful manner, using guest names at every opportunity.
Assess and monitor guest satisfaction throughout their visit and report all guest comments. Liaises and co-operates with other departments on Front Office matters that relate to them.
Be fully informed about daily movement (e.g. Arrivals, Inhouse, VIP guests and functions). Answer the telephones according to Hyatt telephone standards in a polite and courteous manner, using guest name at all times.
Be fully aware of all reservation procedures (in Fidelio RESERVE) and the Credit Policy. Ensure all relevant information is recorded in Fidelio. Guest correspondence and the filing system should be dealt with in a responsible manner.
Upon check-in, ensure that the guest fills in the registration card completely and legibly and reconfirm all details (e.g. departure date and time, room rate and type). Ascertains a method of payment is taken and makes sure that the requested room has been allocated. Showing the guest all the facilities of the Hotel while escorting to the room.
Upon departure, review the charges on the guest's invoice prior to check-out. Obtain the guest's comments and invite him/her to fill out a Guest comment card. Offer to make a return reservation or a next destination booking. "Is there anything else I can do for you?"
Handles cash transactions (including foreign exchange) accurately, according to Hotel standards and maintains integrity of personal float.
Opens and closes Safety Deposit boxes according the Hotel standards.
Actions and records room moves, ensuring that the information is passed to all relevant departments.
Qualifications:
The ideal candidate will have relevant experience in the same or similar role within a five star hotel environment, ideally with a relevant degree or diploma in Hospitality or Tourism management. Good customer service, communications and interpersonal skills are a must. A good working knowledge of Opera would be beneficial.
Knowledge of Chinese (speaking and written) would be desirable
If you are a motivated, flexible team player with attention to detail and committed to guest satisfaction, we would like to hear from you. Job: Front Office

item.title: (USA-TX-Houston (ABS Plaza)) Executive Admin Assistant
item.description:
Executive Admin Assistant Job Type: Full-Time Location: TX, Houston (ABS Plaza) Last Updated: 05/08/2013
Job Description:
Principal Duties and Responsibilities (PDR) 1. Provides overall Administrative responsibilities for the Vice President of HR and support to the HR Division worldwide. Manages highly confidential and sensitive material with discretion on a daily basis. 2. Provides general administrative support to the Manager of Talent Development including training event facility scheduling and preparation of employee development and training materials 3. May make important social arrangements for entertaining clients and other outside business guests. 10. Responsible for coordination and maintenance of HR programs to include but limited to Scholarships, Tuition Reimbursement, ABS Directory and Executive Directory Service Awards, 25 year luncheons. 11. Responsible for collection, tracking and reporting for programs such as Transfer of Class, Spot Bonus payments, and Conflict of Interest programs. 12. May provide work direction and instruction to other office support staff. 13. Serves in an administrative capacity on department project teams when necessary. 14. Maintains office supply inventory for the department. 15. Enter time sheets on a weekly basis into an automated accounting system. 16. Additional duties that may be performed and will be defined individually by HR Leadership team.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required (KSAR) 1. High School Diploma or equivalent. Some college strongly preferred 2. Minimum five (5) years previous administrative office experience or a combination of education and experience. Prior human resources work experience is strongly preferred. 3. 4. Advanced skills in office automation software (some of which may include spreadsheets, word processing, presentation, mail/calendar/scheduler programs, and graphic/drawing software). Ability to learn additional programs as required. 5. Excellent oral and written communication skills. 6. Ability to handle routine and non-routine business matters in the absence of or on behalf of a Manager. 7. Ability to simultaneously handle multiple assignments and prioritize workload accordingly. 8. Demonstrated ability to interface with all levels of personnel. 9. Excellent written and oral communications, interpersonal skills and detail orientation. Superior customer service skills. High level of diplomacy and ability to maintain confidentiality required. item.description: Catapult Technology is a mid-tier information technology and management consulting firm. We join big company expertise with small company attitude that encourages trust, teamwork, and integrity. We are looking for motivated, adaptable professionals who want to work at a company where their skills and expertise will be applied and appreciated. Belvoir, VA Security: Secret Job Description: The applicant must demonstrate sufficient knowledge in Cybersecurity, Information Assurance (IA), or Computer Network Defense (CND) in a complex military command, control, communications, computers, intelligence, and weapons systems environment. The applicant should have a basic knowledge of Information Assurance policy and guidance, and be capable of identifying and recommending acceptable levels of technical and operational risk related to IA and CND. The candidate must possess one or more of the DoD 8570.01 IAM Level 1 professional certifications. A Security+ is desired. Required Demonstrated Experience: Knowledge of the DoD IA Controls, DISA STIGs, and IAVM processes At least two years of IA experience working with or supporting the Federal Government with briefing experience Effective oral and written communication skills (writing samples may be requested) Participate in a variety of complex project tasks applying knowledge of DoD IA principles including: Network Security, Operations Security, Communications Security, Continuity of Operations and Disaster Recovery Planning A basic understanding of CND principles and functions (e.g. firewalls, IDS, IPS, etc) A basic understanding of Wireless security principles and practices A minimum Associates degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related technical discipline is required. Comparable work experience may substitute for education Works closely with customer and team leads to ensure program meets customer objectives Skilled in Microsoft Office automation software: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook, and SharePoint DoD 8570.01 IAM Level 1 certification, or higher Must possess a current U.S. Secret or above Security Clearance. Desired Experience: Working within or understanding a Military Headquarters Organization Working within or understanding a multi-vendor environment At least three or more years of IA experience working within one or more DoD or Federal organizations Understanding and comprehension of the relationships between DoD 8500.02, NIST 800-53, the Public Key Infrastructure and the DoD Test and Evaluation (TandE) process CISSP, CISM, CISA Certification(s) 745-MH1157@apply.maxhire.net We are proud to be an EEO/AA employ

item.title: (USA-VA-Charlottesville) Logistics Coordinator
item.description: Background: IRC Charlottesville provides resettlement services to approximately 200 newly arriving refugees each year as well as ongoing support to refugees and asyless already in the community. A dedicated staff of 15 professionals and 2 Americorps volunteers offers an array of programs including employment, education, family support, immigration and interpreter services. Scope of Work: The Logistics Coordinator is responsible for coordinating the logistical operations in support of the resettlement services team. The Logistics Coordinator reports to the Manager of Resettlement Services. Responsibilities:Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to: Secure appropriate, affordable housing for all new arrivals. Coordinate the logistics of apartment set-ups (furniture orders, supply delivery, utility hook andndash;up, and home safety inspections, etc). Implement procurement by maintaining an accurate inventory of supplies, planning and placing orders, researching vendors, and maintaining associated documentation. Report to senior management on all operational issues and escalating those issues requiring additional attention. Coordinate client home repair requests with landlords and property managers; track resolution of concern and document accordingly. Ensure financial documentation in client case files is complete, accurate, current and in compliance with mandated timelines. Provide community orientation presentation to all new arrivals; coordinate with casework team and complete required documentation for client case files. Maintain and update informational database on all refugee clients served under state contract including services provided by IRC Charlottesville. Requirements: Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience. Demonstrated ability to prioritize time effectively and work well under pressure. Excellent communication skills, with fluency in written and spoken English. Proven success achieving goals and working effectively with all levels of staff in a multicultural environment, ideally with some experience working with refugees or immigrants. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook). Valid driverandrsquo;s license, reliable vehicle with current insurance, and the ability to travel regularly throughout the service delivery area (home visits, agency visits, service provider visits etc).

item.description: Job Description Job Purpose: To sell and service group and catering events that qualify based upon selective sell targets of sleeping rooms and meeting space, not to exceed 75 rooms during peak night or 150 people per event. On a regular basis, distribute final Rooming Lists and Banquet Event Orders to all applicable service staff, including the Banquet Service Staff, the Food Preparation Staff and the Rooms Division. Conduct site inspections. Entertain qualified potential clients in accordance with JQH policies. In a timely, accurate and consistent manner, document and report all sales activities as required. Maintain an active list of top accounts to ensure continuous relationship building activities. Top accounts should be contacted, visited, entertained, etc. frequently. Perform other services and duties as requested by the General Manager. May be called on to host functions and participate in, or conduct sales blitzes, travel and work extended hours to achieve departmental goals. Other duties as assigned. Job Skills: Exhibit computer skills to include word processing, spreadsheet, and familiarity with brand specific property Management System(s). Exercise excellent communication, presentation, organization, time management and listening skills. Use analytical skills for measuring business potential and value to the hotel. Job Qualifications: Education Bachelors Degree or University in Hospitality, Business, Marketing, or related field Experience Minimum 1 -2 years experience in Convention Services, Banquet, Hotel Sales, Marketing, ; OR equivalent education and experience. item.title: (USA-VA-Newport News) LPN Manager/Nurse Mentor
item.description: Riverside Health System seeks a LPN Manager/Nurse Mentor for our Memory Support Unit for our facility The Gardens at Warwick Forest. The Nurse Mentor is passionate about working with the frail and elderly with cognitive deficit. The Nurse Mentor will work in partnership with the Household Coordinator and under the guidance of the Director of Nursing to promote the residentandrsquo;s well-being and satisfaction by supporting resident directed care. The Nurse Mentor provides clinical leadership to the household ensuring that the mission, vision, and values of the organization are supported through the clinical services provided in the households. The Nurse Mentor participates in the planning, organizing, directing and facilitating the clinical operations of the household to ensure regulatory compliance, nurture a person-centered and resident directed culture, strengthen the ability of the household to grow as a separate and effective home, and promote individual and team learning in the household. The Household Nurse Mentor will ensure that each resident receives professional licensed assessments and evaluations and coordinates their care with other nursing staff in the household. As an employee of the Household, the Nurse Mentor is considered a versatile worker and is cross-trained in different functions of the Household within scope of licensure (if applicable) in order to meet resident needs as they occur. EDUCATION: Graduate of a school of practical nursing. LICENSURE: Licensed or eligible by the State of Virginia as an LPN. EXPERIENCE: 3 years of progressive management experience in the area of medical/surgical nursing preferably in Long Term Care or CCRC. Demonstrated ability in Charge Nurse role (2 years). Leadership experience with a strong emphasis in team development preferred. Demonstrated competencies in critical thinking and commitment to highest clinical outcomes desired. Riverside Health System offers a competitive salary, compensation package and benefits to include: tuition reimbursement, Health, Dental, Retirement, Life Insurance and much more!! To be considered for this opportunity interested candidates must submit an application on our website: www.riversideonline.com/careers.

item.title: (USA-VA-Arlington) Senior Business Analyst (REQ 756)
item.description: MicroTech provides Technology Services, Network Systems Integration, Product Solutions, Cloud Computing, Unified Communications and Collaboration, Cyber Security, Mobility, and Social Media Solutions as well as leadership/management skills courses, business simulations and vital industry certifications as part of MicroTech University to both public and private sectors managing more than half-a-million technology users daily. A prime contractor of over 100 Federal projects and more-than-25 procurement vehicles, MicroTech offers access to 2500 vendors and a million technology products and services across the government. JOB TITLE: Senior Business Analyst LOCATION: Arlington, VA (Occasional travel to DOD Customer Site in Quantico, VA) REPORTS TO: Project Manager - Army CID POSITION SUMMARY:The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for developing functional requirements for our DOD Customer. The candidate will be responsible for soliciting and documenting requirements and ensuring they are built into the system to meet customer expectations. This is a client facing position and you will become an expert in communicating application functionality and assisting in documenting requirements, testing and training. Working with customers, prepare detailed specifications from which the clientandrsquo;s application will be constructed. Analyze business related issues to formulate and develop new or modified solutions. Develop functional specifications, design specifications, test plans, and security requirements. Assist customer in defining work processes and system requirements. Identify areas where systems solutions will meet the customer needs. The Senior Functional Analyst will document all requirements and testing efforts. Will supervise the work of a lower level Business Analyst. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBLITIES: Lead in the elicitation and development of functional and operations requirements Work closely with the customer to detail and convert functional requirements into system and operations requirements Address requirements work as a liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements and business processes Lead the development of documentation for analysis as it relates to SDLC Provide clear and concise documentation of customer high level and detailed requirements Facilitate and manage group requirement review sessions Develop business process models, use cases and scenarios QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS and KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS: 5+ years of related experience in Business / Functional / Systems / or Requirements Analyst. BA/BS degree is highly desired. In lieu of a degree, commensurate years of relevant experience may be accepted. Experience leading requirements teams, preferably in a DOD or Federal systems environment Experience with CMM Level 2 or higher processes is a plus Must be able to pass a DoD background investigation and obtain/maintain an Interim/Final Secret clearance. GENERAL INFORMATION: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of personnel so classified.The incumbent must be able to work in a fast-paced environment with demonstrated ability to juggle and prioritize multiple, competing tasks and demands and to seek supervisory assistance as appropriate.Incumbents within this position may be required to assist or find appropriate assistance to make accommodations for disabled individuals in order to ensure access to the organizationand#39;s services (may include: visitors, patients, employees, or others). item.title: (USA-VA-Herndon) Application Infrastructure Engineer
item.description: Application Infrastructure Engineer Why should you consider joining MicroPact? Because itandrsquo;s rewarding.Our focus on outcomes and innovate-like-crazy approach has helped us become one of the fastest growing companies in the Washington, DC area. MicroPact serves over 140 Federal agencies as well as Fortune 500 organizations through the development of advanced Data Tracking and Business Process Management software.http://www.micropact.com/blog/detail/why-work-at-micropactPOSITION SUMMARY: MicroPact, Inc., a product development IT firm seeks a motivated individual as an Application Infrastructure Engineer at our Herndon, VA location with some local travel. This position offers extensive opportunity for growth, a fun working environment and includes a company-paid benefits package. EOE If your duct tape and bailing wire is command line and Java, we might just have a job for you. If you wish that your business card just said andldquo;MacGyverandrdquo; then youandrsquo;re in the right place. In a past life you were a sys admin that bent shells to his will, but grew bored with it. Or maybe you were a developer who had more fun writing build scripts and tools to support the platform. If all of those jobs seemed like a poor fit, itandrsquo;s time to try something new. The Application Infrastructure Engineer is not only going to be architecting and engineering production application environments, theyandrsquo;ll be able to fix them when they go down. When the application server crashes because it canandrsquo;t bind on ports, this ninja knows that the OS may be the culprit and how to fix it. The Application Infrastructure Engineer fixes things, even things they didnandrsquo;t make. They donandrsquo;t deal with functional requirements, they deal with optimizing Web Container settings and making client requirements work. Let the developers write the code, youandrsquo;ll make things work. REQUIREMENTS: Familiarity with programming and software development (from understanding building, compilation, etc. to pieces of server and client applications), even if you donandrsquo;t ever do it, you may need it. Familiar with Java Web Containers (ex: Tomcat, JBoss, WebSphere, WebLogic, Oracle Application Server). Apache and Apache additions (Mod JK, Rewrite, SSL, etc.). Background in networking: TCP/IP (collision avoidance algorithms, how it works, etc.), firewalls/NATs, tunneling, port forwarding, etc. Linux/Windows Server 2008 and later andndash; Architecture, engineering and administration Virtualization andndash; VMWare 5 and later. Familiarity with security requirements for Federal and Commercial entities. Experience with SSH. Experience with database administration andndash; Oracle, MS SQL. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Set up development and production application environments. Support Application Infrastructure, keeping the Swiss Army Knife handy. Assisting development teams with new infrastructure (new web server software, new load balancing, etc.). Configuring Interconnections between the hosted applications at the MicroPact Data Center and Federal/Commercial systems. Developing a performance monitoring structure for all of MicroPactandrsquo;s Applications Flexibility to work outside of business hours as a release schedule, or application implementation/maintenance, requires.

item.title: (USA-VA-Vienna) Insurance Agent
item.description: Position OverviewDo you have aspirations to run your own business? If so, you may want to consider working in the office of Rhea Baker - State Farm Agent. As a member of our agency team, you have an opportunity to experience first-hand what it takes to be an entrepreneur. You will build and develop customer relationships within the community to promote State Farm products including auto, home and life insurance. This position will allow you to experience working in an agentand#39;s office and to explore the opportunity to become a State Farm agent yourself.Responsibilities Develop leads, schedule appointments, identify customer needs, and market appropriate products and services. Use a customer-focused, needs-based review process to educate customers about insurance options. This is a sales position. As an Agent Team Member, you will receive... Salary plus commission/bonus Health benefits Paid time off (vacation and personal/sick days) Growth potential/Opportunity for advancement within my officeRequirements Sales experience (outside sales or inside sales representative, retail sales associate, or telemarketing) preferred Successful track record of meeting sales goals/quotas preferred Excellent communication skills - written, verbal and listening Enthusiastic about the role insurance and financial products play in helping people manage the risks of everyday life, recover from the unexpected, and realize their dreams People-oriented Organizational skills Ability to work in a team environment Knowledge of financial services products Knowledge of life products Property and Casualty license (must be able to obtain) Life and Health license (must be able to obtain)If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process.This position is with a State Farm independent contractor agent, not with State Farm Insurance Companies. Employees of State Farm agents must be able to successfully complete any applicable licensing requirements and training programs. By accepting this position, you are not guaranteed an agency position with State Farm Insurance Companies. As an agent team member, you will still need to go through the regular State Farm agent selection process when you are ready to pursue an agency opportunity. State Farm agents are independent contractors who hire their own employees. State Farm agentsandrsquo; employees are not employees of State Farm.For immediate interview consideration, please click here to apply: http://RheaBaker.SFAgentJobs.com/j/IpF

item.title: (USA-VA-Dulles) Software Engineer
item.description: The Software Engineer will design, develop, test, document and implement technical applications and application enhancements to GWSand#39;s internal systems, such as Benchmarking report system for RF test drive data. Because GWS has a wide range of clients who may use different types of wireless communication protocols (e.g. CDMA, GSM, EDGE, UMTS, HSPA, 1xRTT, 1xEVDON and WiMax) this will result in software tools being customized to each wireless networking providersand#39; needs and specifications. The Software Engineer will work closely with the RF Engineering team. He/she is responsible for implementing the means by which to measure network carrier performance and developing and testing these applications using VB.NET, VBS, console applications, and SQL Server. The Software Engineer also interacts with other GWS departments to troubleshoot and provide solutions to technical problems.Primary duties and responsibilities (but not limited to): Design, develop, test, document and implement technical applications and application enhancements to the GWS internal system. Customize software tools for each wireless networking providerand#39;s needs and specifications. Utilizing wireless communications protocols such as: CDMA, GSM, EDGE, UMTS, HSPA, 1xRTT, 1xEVDO, and WiMax. Works closely with the RF Engineering team to implement the means by which to measure network carrier performance, and developing and testing these applications using SQL Server. Assists other departments to troubleshoot and provide solutions to technical problems.

item.title: (USA-VA-FAIRFAX) IT Security Analyst
item.description: Responsibilities:The IT Security Analyst is responsible for developing security procedures and methods necessary to ensure the safety of information systems and to protect the system from intentional (unauthorized) or accidental (inadvertent) access or destruction. Requires in-depth knowledge of domain structures, user authentication and authorization, encryption and digital signatures and networking. Evaluates security exposures and threats to determine the level of security necessary to protect the information systems. Implement security measures such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems and other security software or devices as required. Ability to: Interpret and apply Federal, State and local policies, procedures, laws and regulations.Administer procedures related to safety and security.Respond to emergency situations and security incidents quickly and efficiently.Work independently and be able to lead a team of security professionals.Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.Train staff in security and incident response procedures.Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work.Ability to maintain the confidentially of security operations and related information. Requirements:Four or more years performing risk assessments, audits and performing security planning, accreditation and policy development. Previous experience with DoD\processes desired, as well as, incident response experience. Knowledge of Security infrastructure products like McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator, Cisco IDS/IPS/ASA, hard drive encryption deployments required. Experience with performing vulnerability assessments and information security audits. Familiarity with enforcing security policies, and recommending revisions to policies to ensure proper IT security. Good understanding of security awareness training to users and IT Personnel and Business Continuity plans and processes. Experience with HIPAA, Privacy Act, DISA, NIST or OMB regulations and standards is desired.Bachelors Degree in Information Systems, Criminal Justice or Security or related fields. Masterandrsquo;s Degree Preferred.CISSP, CISA, GIAC, or Security+ certification required.Secret clearance or eligible to obtain a secret clearance.ASM is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

item.title: (USA-MS-Arkabutla) PM Relief / Replacement / Arkabutla, MS
item.description: This is a position for a Postmaster Relief with the U.S. Postal Service at a location assignment in Arkabutla, MS. This is a non-career position discussed at interview. In the absence of the Postmaster, supervises and provides any combination of window, box, general delivery, rural route, highway contract route, or city delivery services for a small community. May also be assigned projects such as rural mail count for up to 6 days a week. Functional Purpose: When the Postmaster is on leave or not available, supervises and provides any combination of window, box, general delivery, rural route, highway contract route, or city delivery services for a small community. Duties and Responsibilities include: Operates a small, single unit postal facility supervising a small size group of carriers and/or clerks in the performance of distribution, delivery, and window services; Implements and adheres to approved programs as they apply to local requirements; operates within established postal rules, laws, and regulations; Submits and monitors a small operating budget; Trains new employees to ensure quality service; Ensures that proper safeguards are instituted for the welfare of customers and the protection of the mails; Maintains files and records and submits reports; May personally handle window transactions and perform distribution tasks as the workload requires; Has regular contact with postal customers; Exercises normal protective care of accountable paper, building equipment, and office supplies; Exercises a normal regard for the safety of self and others. Applicants must live within 50 miles of the facility address in order to be eligible for this position because the work is performed in the Facility Location and candidates will need to be present for screening activities, including an interview. Qualified applicants must successfully pass a pre-employment drug screening to meet the U.S. Postal Service's requirement to be drug free. Applicants must also be a U.S. citizen or have permanent resident alien status.

item.description: This is a position for a Rural Carrier Associate with the U.S. Postal Service at a location assignment in Winona, MS. This is a non-career position discussed at interview. Cases, delivers, and collects mail along a prescribed rural route using a vehicle; provides customers on the route with a variety of services. Duties and Responsibilities include: Sorts mail in delivery sequence for the assigned route; Receives and signs for accountable mail; Loads mail in vehicle; Delivers mail to customers along a prescribed route and on a regular schedule by a vehicle; collects monies and receipts for accountable mail; Picks up mail from customers' roadside boxes; Sells stamps, stamped paper and money orders; accepts C.O.D., registered, certified, and insured mail and parcel post; Furnishes routine information concerning postal matters and provides requested forms to customer; Returns mail collected, undeliverable mail, and submits monies and receipts to post office; Prepares mail for forwarding amd maintains records of change of address information; Prepares a daily trip report and maintains a list of the customers on the route; Conducts special surveys when required; Maintains an inventory of stamps and stamped paper as needed to provide service to customers on the route; Provides for mail security at all times. Required Qualifications include: Must be able to pass a written exam (to be scheduled); Must be able to sort, deliver, and collect all classes of mail weighing up to 70 pounds; Must have a valid state driver's license and a safe driving record; Must have at least two years of documented driving experience; Qualified applicants must successfully pass a pre-employment drug screening to meet the U.S. Postal Service's requirement to be drug free; Applicants must be a U.S. citizen or have permanent resident alien status; Applicants must live within 50 miles of the facility address in order to be eligible for this position because the work is performed in the Facility Location and candidates will need to be present for screening activities, including an interview.

item.title: (USA-MS-Meridian) Cook / Housekeeper - Meridian
item.description: This position is for a Full time Cook / Housekeeper with a company location in Meridian, MS. Duties and Responsibilities will include: Prepare and serve food, per schedule, based on menu in quantities and qualities to meet the Company requirements while complying with all sanitation, health, and personal hygiene standards; Use supplies and equipment such that waste and loss of food is minimized; Will be responsible for performing housekeeping duties to ensure assigned areas are clean and sanitized. Duties that are more detailed include but are not limited to the following: Plan weekly lunch menu (two weeks in advance); Have lunch prepared on time, no later than 11:50 a.m. each day; Submit list of supplies and food requirements to purchasing; Pick up supplies on Thursdays, and run errands as warranted; Check/clean owners' office/restroom daily and restock as needed. This job is typically an 8-hour workday but the applicant must be willing to work frequent overtime and weekends during the company's heavy seasons. Requirements and Qualifications include: High school diploma or equivalent is preferred; MUST have 3-5 years (required) documented cafeteria or restaurant cooking experience (fast food does not apply); Current Serv-Safe Certificate preferred, or must be able to pass and maintain this certification within specified period; Must have moderate reading, writing and good professional communication and interpersonal skills; Must be able to meet the physical requirements necessary to perform this position to include lifting heavy pots/pans from one station to another, sweep, mop and perform other cleaning responsibilities; Must be physically and mentally aware of any hazards or dangers at all times; Must have a valid Driver's license with an acceptable MVR; Must successfully complete pre-employment screening as dictated by company policy, which includes a complete background check with Drug Screening and Motor Vehicle Records Check (this position will require work related driving). Applicants will be rated considering both length and quality of specialized experience in the Cooking-Housekeeping fields or related activities. Salary depending on experience discussed at interview.For consideration Applicants must indicate possession of KSA's on a document separate from their resume'. Failure to provide sufficient information relating to KSAs may result in a resume' not ranking among the most qualified applicants. KSA's:(1) Knowledge and understanding of standard cooking / cleaning methods (2) Knowledge of preparing, cooking, serving, and storing food safely (3) Knowledge regarding industrial cooking utensils, equipment and cleaning supplies (4) Knowledge and understanding of general housekeeping (5) Skills and ability to plan, coordinate, and perform cooking-housekeeping duties efficiently (6) Ability to make general decisions and work un-supervised most of the time.

item.title: (USA-MS-Brandon) Collections Specialist II / Brandon, MS 2013-5956
item.description: This position is for a Collections Specialist II with a bank located in Brandon, MS. The purpose of this job is to maintain an effective collections effort on an assigned group of accounts/loans resulting in fewer delinquent loans and minimizing losses. This position may be a front end or back end collector depending on business needs. Responsibilities: Activities and duties may vary depending upon functional area assigned, mainly responsible for simple to moderately complex consumer or commercial accounts/loans; This position requires moderate supervision; Conducting inbound or outbound collection calls utilizing a predictive dialer, preview or other technology; Negotiating payment terms for delinquent accounts and accurately notating the account following departmental procedures; Assisting with difficult collection problems such as: payment disputes, alternative payment arrangements, CCC, out of policy extensions, Insurance claims, foreclosure or repossession request, etc.; Recognizing problem accounts/loans, alerting management and providing input on a suitable course of action; Skip tracing and other specialty queues as assigned. Qualifications: Upper level knowledge and understanding of collection industry standards of practice including a working knowledge of privacy and fair debt collection regulations, bankruptcy, repossession, including replevins, foreclosure and other consumer credit laws affecting collection of debt; General knowledge of the lending process from point of application to note documentation; General knowledge of credit bureau information and other sources of consumer reporting; Good communication and interpersonal skills; Strong organizational and analytical skills; Good judgment; Strong negotiating and decision-making skills; Strong PC skills; Team player and supporter; High School and/or some college education with 3 or more years of related external and or internal collection experience, (minimum 1 year internal) working similar consumer, mortgage or commercial products; Job related experience will be considered.

Will be responsible for providing a variety of sales and service functions, including making referrals, processing savings, checking and loan transactions, cashing checks and selling Official Checks. The Primary Responsibilities include: Inform customers of the bank about services and provide an exceptional customer experience; Provide quality service to customers of the bank through both the lobby and drive-in of the branch; Work as part of the Branch team to ensure individual and branch goals are met. The Primary Duties include: Understand the bank mission, organizational structure, employee handbook, bank security, policies and procedures, standards of conduct and incentive program; Establish weekly Sales goals and look for opportunities to recommend additional products and services; Desire to share responsibility of Sales goals with Team; Have an awareness of general banking services; Have general knowledge of bank s products and services; Be aware of competitor bank services and advantages of bank; Promote bank services and cross sell bank products through referrals; Operate network computers / software, and other equipment necessary to handle transactions; Accept deposits of cash and/or checks; Process withdrawals and cash checks up to designated limits; Have knowledge about the importance and requirements of, and how to complete Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs); Accept loan payments of all types; Redeem cash items for deposit or cash; Provide information for customers regarding products and services; Sell official checks, bank money orders and travelers checks (if offered); Process cash advances on credit / debit cards; Balance cash and negotiable items; Participate in on-going training; Know where the CRA notice, statement and public disclosure file is located in the branch, and who the CRA Officer is; Know when to report suspicious transactions / activity / situations to appropriate personnel; Participate in the general upkeep and appearance of the branch. Requirements and Qualifications include: Minimum High school graduate or participate in a qualified high school work program; Basic math aptitude and proficiency; Demonstrated positive academic record; Achievement in social and/or extracurricular activities preferred; Must have a professional appearance and manner; Successful completion of all required CSR training; Ability to achieve personal Sales goals; Excellent attendance record; Good hand / eye coordination; Good mathematical ability; Read, write, speak clearly over the phone and one-on-one conversation; Count currency and coin; Operate CSR related equipment; Read on-line computer screen. item.title: (USA-MS-Pascagoula) Manager Production and Scheduler 3 4482BR
item.description: External Job Description Plans, prepares, issues and controls production schedules and coordinates with material requirements to ensure a controlled flow of approved materials timed to meet production requirements. Advises management of the status of work in progress, material availability, and potential production problems to ensure that personnel, equipment, materials and services are provided as needed. Schedules equipment and personnel, confirms material supply and demands, prepares work orders or purchase requests for the production or purchase of components or parts based on a master production schedule, shop load and inventory requirements. Coordinates interdepartmental activity with quality assurance, manufacturing, purchasing, engineering, inventory control, traffic, etc.; schedules and expedites the movement of parts by means of move orders, stock transfers and requests for shipping orders. Manages the organizations responsible for creation and maintenance of labor and capacity planning deliverables. Works closely with schedulers to anticipate schedule changes that may have an impact to planning products. Support the strategic business plans by performing "what if" analysis in support of strategic business objectives and future business opportunities. Advises management of the status of labor planning issues, and capacity issues. Recommends solutions and work arounds based upon information provided by the selected candidate's working products. He/she also uses this information to predict potential production problems to ensure that personnel, equipment, materials and services are provided as needed. Schedules equipment and personnel, based upon the master construction schedule. Coordinates interdepartmental activity with programs, scheduling, planning and crafts. Works with the team to identify ways to improve the department's deliverables by recommending tool changes and/or process changes. Additional common management responsibilities as listed in Shipbuilding Management Charter 0001 within command media (SBMC 0001) and applicants should review the Charter and policies and procedures before applying for position. Basic Qualifications Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, or related field of study with 10 years of relevant work experience OR Masters degree with 8 years of relevant experience OR High School Diploma/GED and 18 years related work experience required. Familiarity with Capacity Planning and/or Labor Planning tools. Demonstrated ability to present to Senior Management and Customer Program Offices. Preferred Qualifications Engineer Degree preferred.

item.title: (USA-MS-Laurel) Comm Tech 1, Install .and. Serv. / Laurel, MS 5/7/13
item.description: This position is for a Comm Tech 1, Installation and Service, with a provider of media, entertainment and communication services located in Laurel, MS. Tasks: Performs reconnects, requested and non-pay disconnects and changes of service, while adhering to Comcast procedures and safe work practices, NEC and NESC requirements, and local ordinances in order to provide (or remove) services to the customer; Pre-wires single dwelling units and multiple dwelling units (MDUs) in order to provide ready hook-up capabilities at the time of moving in; Completes associated paperwork with each work order in a timely manner in order to ensure all details of the work are recorded for entry in the customer's account once the work is checked in; Performs service calls; Reviews all requested services with the customer in order to ensure understanding and agreement; Troubleshoots the drop from the tap to the customer's equipment; Installs and removes converters in order to provide customer with upgrades or downgrades in service and determines acceptability of service by reviewing picture quality following connection of cable service in order to provide the best possible service for the customer; Provides the customer with materials regarding channel lineup, use of converter and company policies as they relate to the customer as well as demonstrates these skills in order to educate the customer on the use of the equipment and company guidelines; Cleans, maintains and stocks vehicle and equipment in order to be prepared to perform required duties; Inspects existing ground or makes new ground according to the National Electrical Code (NEC) in order to protect employees, customers and equipment from electrical shock or damage; Properly operates and maintains installation tools and equipment; Reports need for vehicle repair or service when required and/or prescribed; Reports any accidents, losses, injuries, or property damage to Supervisor and customer when appropriate; Applies knowledge and skills of training on the job in order to prepare for transition to the next level and performs other duties as requested by Supervisor in order to achieve departmental goals and objectives; Ability to use basic cable installation tools and hand tools and perform jobs from high places (on poles and roofs,) including climbing poles with proper equipment (safety belt, strap, climbers,) ladders and bucket trucks (18 to 20 feet,) as determined by the system's requirements; Reads general system layouts from blueprints, basic knowledge of mathematics, cable television products and services; Knowledge of the National Electrical Code (NEC,) the National Electrical Safety Code (NESC,) the Occupational Safety and Health Act (OSHA), various state and local codes including G.O. 95 and G.O. 128, (when applicable,) and the policies and procedures for CATV installation activities; Communicates with customers in a clear and straight forward manner; Proven ability to work independently and to prioritize and organize effectively; Manipulates connectors, fasteners, wire and use hand tools, works in areas with exposure to moderate noise levels; Lifts and carries loads of 70 lbs. or more, works in confined spaces such as crawl spaces or attics, works while standing 50 -70% of the time and performs work near power lines and electricity; Drives company vehicle in performance of duties in a safe and responsible manner while working and traveling in inclement weather; Vision ability-close vision, peripheral vision and ability to adjust focus and able to manipulate objects such as pens, keyboard and mouse; Normal work shift may include weekends; may include 10 hour days for 4 days a week and available to work overtime including weekends, evenings and holidays; Exposure to moderate noise level, dogs or other animals, construction areas, or the public in general, may be a concern; Able to apply common sense, theory, and experience to decision-making; able to recognize similarities between past and present situation; able to identify key issues or use inductive reasoning in complex situations and to communicate courteously and pro-actively; able to learn customers' short term and long term needs; see issues from customers' position, and recommend products or service; able to promote customer focus in employees and develop partnerships with customers, Able to persist and finish projects despite obstacles, or redirect when necessary; able to follow instructions or take action and address opportunities with little supervision; able to take extra steps to prevent mistakes or create opportunities; Regular, consistent and punctual attendance; Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary; Able to use active listening skills or attend to non-verbal cues to better understand others' perspectives, behaviors or motivations; Able to empathize with others' needs and respond sensitively; Able to use good judgment when responding and respond to objections successfully; Completion of 45 days (maximum) of service employees must complete the certification as required; The employee must have successfully completed the following training programs, Safety Program, Company-specific training on policies and procedures, Installer Training, Customer Contact, Product Knowledge and Sales. After the initial 45 days, an employee may be advanced to the next level provided that there has been satisfactory development of the necessary skills and ability to perform the above tasks as determined by the certification assessments including passing the written assessment, skills assessment and meet Company Employee Standards and supervisor's approval; Skills requirements: High School or Equivalent; Generally requires 0-2 years related experience.

Preferred Qualifications: Clinical assessment skills at the level necessary to meet the job requirements; Knowledge of nursing and medical practices and procedures, as well as laws, regulations, and guidelines that pertain to long term care; Knowledge of Medicare regulations and coverage guidelines as related to skilled nursing; Knowledge of case mix guidelines as indicated by state specific reimbursement model; Ability to plan, organize, develop, implement and interpret the programs, goals, objectives, policies and procedures, etc., that are necessary for providing quality care; Proven written and oral communication skills; Proven decision making and analytical skill with ability to make independent decisions on a regular basis; Capable of researching new methods and principles to incorporate them into existing nursing practices; Must be able to maintain confidentiality regarding patient and company proprietary information; Must have the ability to relate professionally and positively and work cooperatively with residents, families and other employees at all levels.

item.description: This Position is for a Crew Leader ? Concrete with a utility specialty company with opportunity in Pascagoula. Qualifications: High School Diploma or GED; One to Two years of related experience; Prior experience in concrete field; Basic computer skills a plus; Must have a valid drivers license issued by the State of Mississippi; Must be able to carry or handle up to and possibly over 50 lbs.; Must pass a drug screening and driving record must be sufficient to maintain insurability on the Companys vehicle liability policy to operate motor vehicles owned by the City or the Company; Ability to use thinking and reasoning to solve a problem; Ability to communicate effectively with others using the spoken word; Ability to find a solution for or to deal proactively with work-related problems; Ability to identify and correct conditions that affect employee safety; Work is performed in and around water and sewer collection systems, primarily outside; Worker is subject to adverse weather conditions and environmental conditions, including temperature extremes, humidity and precipitation, noise and vibration from heavy equipment, exposure to physical hazards from equipment with moving parts, high voltage electrical equipment, hazardous chemicals, and bacteria in wastewater.

Value Statement; Performs other duties as assigned; Demonstrates broad knowledge of technology and solutions; Proactively manages resources and priorities workload; Demonstrated ability to multi-task; Possesses strong analytical skills; Demonstrated customer orientation; strength in analytical, math, and reasoning skills; Effectively communicates verbally and in writing; Demonstrated proficiency in MS Office applications; Provides onsite technology support on projects; Must be able to drive to assigned sites to complete work. item.title: (USA-MS-Biloxi) Chief Financial Officer / Biloxi
item.description: This position is for a Chief Financial Officer with a community development agency located in Biloxi, MS. The CFO reports to and partners with the Executive Director to set and carry out the Agency's financial policy and direction while also being an active participant in, and driver of, the organization's overall strategy. The CFO leads all financial administration, business planning, and budgeting. As a member of the senior leadership team, the CFO will work closely with a motivated and engaged Finance and Audit Committee of the Board of Directors. The CFO leads finance, human resources (HR) and has indirect control over Information Technology. Responsibilities include: Partner with the Executive Director and Chief Operating Officer on all operational and strategic issues as they arise; Provide strategic recommendations to the Executive Director, based on financial analysis and projections, cost identification and allocation, and revenue/expense analysis; Participate in the ongoing strategic planning process as an integral member of the senior management team; Oversee long-term budgetary planning and cost management in alignment with Agency's strategic plan; Partner with the Executive Director to align financial management with short and long term financial planning and projections; Engage the board finance committee around issues, trends, and changes in the operating model and operational delivery; Oversee budgeting, and the implementation of budgets, so as to monitor progress and present operational metrics both internally and externally; Ensure that finance staff maintains financial record systems in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, and monitor the use of all funds; Oversee the preparation and approval of all financial reporting materials and metrics for funding organizations and Hope CDA's board of directors; Prepare and communicate monthly and annual financial statements; Manage cash flow and forecasting; direct all financial, project-based, and departmental accounting; Coordinate all audit activities; Evaluate and oversee all benefits negotiations, thus providing the most competitive packages for Hope CDA employees; Review all formal finance, HR, and IT-related procedures, processes, and administration, recommending improvements to the systems in place and managing the systems going forward. Qualifications include: Bachelor's degree in accounting or related field; Advanced knowledge of Quick Books and accounting practices in the state of Mississippi for Non-Profits; "Hands on" Accounting professional intricately involved in the day to day accounting functions; Exceptional written, oral, interpersonal, presentation skills and the ability to effectively interface with the Agency's Board of Directors, staff, and clients; Able to multi-task and attention to details; Able to provide accurate and timely report instead of ability to produce reports on short notice; Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office programs.

item.title: (USA-MS-Oxford) Material Handler (Hi-Lo Driver) - 1st shift
item.description: The RoleOperates forklift and/or hi-lo, walkie rider, hand truck, ladder, picker or reach fork lift, to pick, move, load, unload, and manage flow of required production and/or warehouse material. Operates stock picker/reach fork lift to pick product from controlled locations and deliver to designated work centers or drop points to support locations. More about the JobThis is a 1st shift position. Flexing work schedule and overtime may be required including weekends and/or holidays per business demands. Requires current and continuing right to work in the United States without sponsorship. Requires job seeker to be able to work in Bruce, MS without relocation assistance. Requires ability to lift/move material/product weighing up to 60 pounds, occasionally more (assistance given with heavier objects). Ability to work as contributing member within a team environment. Requires successful completion of math test, reading test, and a job fit assessment. Basic QualificationsTwo years manufacturing experience required. Tenth grade education. item.title: (USA-MS-Biloxi) Case Management Supervisor / Biloxi
item.description: This position is for a Case Management Supervisor with a community development agency located in Biloxi, MS. The Case Management Supervisor will be directly responsible for the oversight of each case management team member, as well as the efficiency and quality of performance and service level. Each Case Management Supervisor and the Case Manager will work with clients to provide financial resources and volunteer services, as the clients work to transition into permanent, safe and secure housing. In addition, the Case Management Supervisor works closely with the real estate endeavors of Hope CDA, including property management and real estate services. Responsibilities include: Responsible for the efficient and effective implementation of Case Management Services; Develop, monitor and report out performance indicators, both internally and externally; Develop and perform periodic audits of case files to ensure compliance and quality of work; Supervise Case Managers by providing direction, input and feedback; Improve systems and processes while ensuring sound change control measures are followed; Establish a mutual trust/work relationship with clients through the process of confidential and respectful intake interviewing, triage, data entry and reports; Conduct initial assessment of client's needs, resources accessed and potential resources available; Design programs specific to needs of individual client. Establish, maintain, and prioritize client files; Work in partnership with Construction Manager to ensure that all projects are completed according to client's individual needs; Interview and track tenants for agency owned rentals; Actively seek new properties for the agency to purchase; Recruit prospective first time homebuyers; Other duties as assigned. Qualifications include: Bachelor's degree in related field or 5 years minimum experience in Case Management, preferably in affordable housing and with certifications from NeighborWorks; Working knowledge of the entire case management process, disaster response and government grant oversight experience preferred; Demonstrated leadership, management, organization, creative problem solving skills including negotiation and conflict resolution; Demonstrated working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and the English language; Bilingual (Spanish/Vietnamese language) helpful; Exceptional written and oral communication skills; Knowledge of Real Estate Transactions; specifically sales, contracts and deeds of trust.

item.title: (USA-MS-Tiplersville) Postmaster Relief (RMPO) - 2HR / Tiplersville, MS
item.description: This position is for a Postmaster Relief (RMPO)- 2HR with the U.S. Postal Service at a location assignment in Tiplersville, MS. Functional Purpose: Provides window, box, and general delivery service for a Remotely Managed Post Office; May provide supervision for city, rural and/or highway contract route service. Duties and Responsibilities: Operates a single unit postal facility providing limited window services, mail distribution, and dispatches; Opens and closes the facility according to established procedures; Operates within established postal rules, laws and regulations; Resolves problems that may occur during operations and escalates issues to Administrative Post Office (APO) when appropriate; Ensures that proper safeguards are instituted for the welfare of customers and the protection of the mails; Maintains files and records and submits reports as required; Answers questions, provides guidance, and has regular contact with postal customers; Exercises protective care of accountable paper, monies, product inventory, and office supplies in accordance to Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) guidelines; May provide for limited city, rural and/or highway contract route delivery service to local customers; Exercises a normal regard for the safety of self and others; May supervise one or more employees. Requirements: Decision Making/Problem Solving: Ability to carry out operational plans and procedures within the framework of policy; Ability to obtain and interpret relevant facts; analyze problems, complaints, and suggestions and take appropriate action or escalate, when necessary, to the Postmaster of the Administrative Post Office. Safety and Health: Knowledge of safety procedures needed to ensure that safe working conditions are maintained; Knowledge of procedures and techniques established to avoid injuries to self, employees (if applicable), and customers; Knowledge of normal accident prevention measures and emergency procedures. Customer and Community Relations: Ability to conduct operations in an attitude of responsive service to customers; Ability to present a favorable Postal Service image to the community; Ability to comprehend and communicate information, both orally and in writing; Knowledge of operating procedures and standards, postal rates and classes, and commonly encountered customer needs; Ability to sell ideas, positions, and recommendations to others; Ability to interact tactfully and relate well with others. Qualified applicants must successfully pass a pre-employment drug screening to meet the U.S. Postal Service's requirement to be drug free. Applicants must also be a U.S. citizen or have permanent resident alien status. Applicants must live within 50 miles of the facility address in order to be eligible for this position because the work is performed in the Facility Location and candidates will need to be present for screening activities, including an interview.

Cases, delivers, and collects mail along a prescribed rural route using a vehicle; provides customers on the route with a variety of services. Duties and Responsibilities include: Sorts mail in delivery sequence for the assigned route; Receives and signs for accountable mail; Loads mail in vehicle; Delivers mail to customers along a prescribed route and on a regular schedule by a vehicle; collects monies and receipts for accountable mail; Picks up mail from customers' roadside boxes; Sells stamps, stamped paper and money orders; accepts C.O.D., registered, certified, and insured mail and parcel post; Furnishes routine information concerning postal matters and provides requested forms to customer; Returns mail collected, undeliverable mail, and submits monies and receipts to post office; Prepares mail for forwarding amd maintains records of change of address information; Prepares a daily trip report and maintains a list of the customers on the route; Conducts special surveys when required; Maintains an inventory of stamps and stamped paper as needed to provide service to customers on the route; Provides for mail security at all times. Required Qualifications include: Must be able to pass a written exam (to be scheduled); Must be able to sort, deliver, and collect all classes of mail weighing up to 70 pounds; Must have a valid state driver's license and a safe driving record; Must have at least two years of documented driving experience; Qualified applicants must successfully pass a pre-employment drug screening to meet the U.S. Postal Service's requirement to be drug free; Applicants must be a U.S. citizen or have permanent resident alien status; Applicants must live within 50 miles of the facility address in order to be eligible for this position because the work is performed in the Facility Location and candidates will need to be present for screening activities, including an interview.

Informs Executive Director of any bus defects and corrective actions. 10. Performs or recommends maintenance of bus as necessary. 11. Works with Transportation Monitor to supervise students. 12. Assists with the implementation of diversity awareness, participates in Center training, and interacts positively with Center staff. 13. Collaborates with the ASP Staff for the facilitation of diversity and inclusion. 14. Supervises students utilizing Center transportation services. 15. Represents the Center positively; performs additional responsibilities as deemed appropriate by supervision. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS Familiarity with diverse cultures and diversity related programs Planning and organizational skills Interpersonal human relations skills Verbal and written communication skills Student management skills Sensitivity to the needs of a diverse student population, including minority and international students Ability to initiate and maintain positive relationships with diverse groups Flexibility to adapt to the changing needs of ASP participants MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Education and experience equivalent to: High School Diploma or GED; Two to four years of post secondary education preferred; Familiar with educational philosophy; Exhibits maturity in assigned role; Able to pass background check; Works well with students and Center staff; Positive demeanor and flexibility is essential. item.title: (USA-SD-PIERRE) City Carrier Assistant I (Mail Carrier)
item.description: Closing Date: 5 19 13 at 11:59 p.m. CDT; These positions will work 20 30 hours per week or more on various days and hours according to schedule and will include weekdays and Saturdays. Applicants must have a valid state driver s license, a safe driving record, and at least two years of driving experience. Qualified applicants must successfully pass a pre employment drug screening to meet the U.S. Postal Service s requirement to be drug free. Applicants must also be a U.S. citizen or have permanent resident alien status. Limited benefits include raises, paid vacation days and access to health insurance as required by law or after the first 360 day term, whichever comes first. This position delivers and collects mail on foot or by vehicle under varying road and weather conditions in a prescribed area; maintains professional and effective public relations with customers and others, requiring a general familiarity with postal laws, regulations, products and geography of the area. Duties .and. Responsibilities include: 1. Routes or cases all classes of mail in sequence of delivery along an established route. Rearranges and relabels cases as required. 2. Withdraws mail from the distribution case and prepares it in sequence for efficient delivery independently or by another carrier along an established route. Prepares and separates all classes of mail to be carried by truck to relay boxes along route for subsequent delivery. 3. Handles undeliverable mail in accordance with established procedures. 4. Delivers mail along a prescribed route, on foot or by vehicle, on a regular schedule, picking up additional mail from relay boxes as needed. Collects mail from street letter boxes and accepts letters from mailing from customers; on certain routes may deliver mail that consists exclusively of parcel post, or the collection of mail. 5. Uses portable electronic scanner as instructed. 6. Delivers and collects charges on customs, postage due, and C.O.D. mail matter. Delivers and obtains receipts for registered and certain insured mail. Signs for such matter, except insured mail, at the post office before beginning route and accounts for it upon return by payments of the amounts collected and delivery of receipts taken. 7. Deposits in the post office mail collected on the route upon returning from the route. 8. Checks, and corrects if necessary, mailing cards from advertisers bearing names and addresses of customers or former customers on the route. 9. Furnishes customers with postal information and provides change of address cards and other postal forms as needed. 10. Reports to supervisor all unusual incidents or conditions relating to mail delivery, including condition of street letter boxes and centralized delivery equipment. 11. Becomes proficient, when assigned to a route, in the casing of mail on other routes as assigned. 12. Works professionally with other employees in the office. 13. May as a CCA, perform clerical duties and be required to pass examinations on scheme of city primary distribution. 14. In addition, may perform any of the following duties: check hotels and other establishments to ensure that mail for residents undeliverable as addressed is not improperly held; deliver stamps or other paper supplies to contract or classified stations and other designated delivery points; serves at carriers delivery window; receive and register where practical, all letters and packages of first class matter properly offered for registration; case mail and make deliveries on other routes as assigned. This position will require a written exam and qualified applicants will be informed of the process to complete this written exam after their application has been submitted. Applicants must be physically able to efficiently perform the duties of the position with or without reasonable accommodation. Job duties require standing, walking, bending and reaching and may involve handling heavy containers of mail.
