item.title: (USA-SD-YANKTON) CMM Programmer
item.description: CMM Programmer EXPECTATIONS FOR THE POSITION OF CMM PROGRAMMER Leadership would be displayed by setting the example in work ethic, participation, taking on new or additional assignments, maintaining high work performance values, and strong, consistent performance of your duties. Leadership would be displayed by involvement in problem solving, new product or process research and development, employee training, and active involvement in the improvement of product or process quality and cost reduction efforts within the organization. This position is considered as one that requires outstanding personal performance; and the holders of this position would be models for others as a performance benchmarking. 1. Accepts leadership responsibilities above; performs a leadership role in the plant. 2. Champion for continuous improvement. 3. Accepts and responds positively to constructive criticism. 4. Effectively communicates to the individuals or to the team; participates in plant and team meetings. Works harmoniously with others; willingness to resolve issues in a diplomatic manner. 5. Treats all employees and visitors with dignity and respect. 1. Responsible for participating in standardizing the processes to be used by the cmm programmers to achieve one common format and following the standardized process. Included in the process is assuring the revision control and changes to the programs that are needed in an accurate, timely manner. 2. Responsible for assuring that the program and inspection process are accurate to assure the part inspected is in compliance with the customers specifications. 3. Responsible for assuring that each step required in the inspection process is documented in the written, standardized work instruction format. 4. When assigned the responsibility for training others, you are expected to assure that the trainee has received adequate training, that the individual is competent to perform their work assignments, and has completed the training documents required. 5. Responsible for reviewing and approving requested changes to the cmm program or to the inspection processes established by the CMM programmer, or were developed by the quality department, or are under the responsibility of the quality department. You are responsible for challenging changes, to assure that the changes are necessary. 1. Actively supports the scheduler in meeting customer dock dates. This is demonstrated by volunteering for extra hours or weekend work when the schedule dictates the need for you to work more hours to complete your assignment in programming or to help out in other areas in support of the customer. Supports other teams or plant members by working to balance the hours worked. 1. Expected to actively research new processes, programming software, or tooling to assist in finding ways to shorten the inspection processes, or reduce the operating costs of the inspection processes. 2. Expected to actively generate cost reduction ideas within the scope of the job, realm of experience on the job or training. Pay based on skills and experience: Level 2 has a pay scale of $14.50 $20.00. Applied Engineering, Inc. offers a competitive benefit package including health, life, disability, and dental insurance, 401(k) retirement plan, bonus program, sick leave program, vacation and holiday pay, For more information on this position, contact Bridget Benson at 605 665 4425 x110 Bridget.Benson appliedeng.com

item.title: (USA-SD-SIOUX FALLS) Fixed Wing Pilot Part Time
item.description: This is a part time 32 hours per pay period position. Fixed Wing Pilot is a licensed fixed wing pilot who is assigned and oriented to the Intensive Air flight team. The pilot is responsible for flying fixed wing flight missions requested by Sanford Health Hospital. Fixed wing pilots must comply with applicable FAA regulations. Must be an experienced pilot. The pilot is directly responsible for all operations pertaining to the safe efficient conduct of the flight from initial dispatch until termination of the flight. Must have a good working knowledge of the company Operations Manual, Federal Aviation Regulations, Operations Specifications, Aircraft Flight Manual, and any other requirements pertinent to specific flights. Must demonstrate interdisciplinary skills when working with team members. Must have effective critical thinking skills to problem solve and immediately respond to changing environments. Required Skills Education Experience Must have completed training and possess at least a Commercial Certificate (FAA) with a Multi Engine Land and an Instrument rating. Must possess at least a current second class medical certificate and be current in commercial, instrument and multi engine flying. The pilot must have successfully completed an approved training program and passed an FAA Part 135 check ride before flying as Pilot in Command on patient missions. 1.Minimum of 2,000 fixed wing flight hours 2.Minimum of 500 multi engine hours, with turbine time desired Must possess an Airline Pilot license with Multi Engine and Instrument rating.

item.title: (USA-MN-HENDRICKS) RN or LPN Long Term Care
item.description: Adheres to the team concept. Works together for the benefit of the residents and the facility. General duties to include assessing, analyzing, planning, implementing, and evaluating resident needs ensuring quality resident care. Provides input and updates the resident s care plan. Ensures that the resident s care plan is followed. Obains, administers, and monitors effectiveness of medications in accordance with facility policies, procedures, and standards of practice. Communicates with medical staff to ensure prompt, quality care. Accompanies medical staff on rounds assisting as needed. Carries out physician orders. Adheres and supports medical care as directed by the medical staff. Communicates with residents regarding their status and care plan. Provides education as needed. Communicates with responsible party(ies) regarding the resident s status and care plan. Communicates resident information to all those involved in the resident s care to ensure quality and continuity of care. Gives nursing care in support and adherence to the philosophy of care and the policies and procedures of the facility. Adheres to the laws relating to the Minnesota Board of Nursing Nurse Practice Act. Adheres to the Standards and Scope of Geriatric Nursing Practice. Maintains the confidentiality of all matters that pertain to the residents, staff, and visitors of the facility. Ensures that all care given and actions taken are done so in accordance to safety policies, procedures, and practices. Follows the concept of rehabilitative nursing. Documents resident information on appropriate forms in a timely manner. Keeps current and adheres to rules, regulations, practices, techniques, policies, and procedures. Attends mandatory facility in services. Attends offered in services for self enrichment to maintain a high quality of nursing practice. Seeks growth through educational opportunities. Participates in QI by providing input to improve quality of care and to strive for ways to improve overall activities and functions of the nursing home. Participates in risk management by providing input to ensure a safe environment and by reporting any malfunctions or needed repairs in equipment or the physical environment. Provides input for updating policies, procedures, and standards of nursing care. Schedules replacement of personnel as needed. Ensures adequate coverage according to standard guidelines. Provides positive leadership and supervision of staff. Supervises and evaluates nursing care. Provides teaching for nursing personnel. Provides input regarding personnel matters.

Other duties as assigned by the Director or other Clinical Leadership. The above statements are intended to be a representative summary of the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job. The incumbents may be requested to perform job related tasks other than those stated in this description. Health Connect at Home expects all our employees to live the values of Reverence, Integrity, Compassion and Excellence at work by: Honoring and caring for the dignity of all persons in mind, body, and spirit Working together as a team to achieve our goals Improving continuously by listening, and asking for and responding to feedback Seeking new and better ways to meet the needs of those we serve Using our resources wisely Understanding how each of our roles contributes to the success of Health Connect at Home and Catholic Health Initiatives

item.title: (USA-SD-SIOUX FALLS) SL Courier (part time)
item.description: Part time 24 hours per pay period. Monday Friday 10am 11:00pm (rotating days and rotating shifts and varying lengths from 6 hours to 12 hours). Sundays 11:30am 6pm (rotating Sundays with varying shift lenghts The Field Service Representative (FSR) is representative that interfaces directly with clinets on a daily basis. In this role, he she provides service informaton to clients, takes comments from clients to be passed on to management, and answers specimen transport integrity questions. The FSR performs the first step of the pre analytical process of specimen preparation for specimen integrity for transport to the laboratory. He she sorts biological specimens in the field according to transport requirements and delivers them. The FSR provides quality control and positive tracking of specimens by maintaining a daily specimen log indicating the number of frozen, refrigerated, room temp, incubated and other specimens that are transported. The FSR performs client education related to proper storge of referred specimens and packaging and labeling of transport containers. The FSR drives a company vehicle to transport laboratory specimens; as well as internal mail, packages, money bags, and equipment for other internal customers (Sanford Health Network, Sanford Clinic, and Sanford USD Medical Center Departments, Sanford Health Corporate, Sanford Health Plan, Patient Financial Services, and Sanford Foundation) according to established Sanford Laboratories Field Service Department policies and procedures. In addition, he she transports packages for external customers according to specifications of contract agreements and established policies and procedures. In the course of performing his her responsibilities, the FSR ensures all packages, supplies and correspondence are categorized properly before initiation of daily route; completes pre trip vehicle inspection before departing on daily route; notifies supervisor when vehicle maintenance is required; keeps vehicles fueled and assists in maintaining appearance of vehicles (car washes, vacuums, etc); maintains security in the use of the company credit card; and ensures that all patient information, incoming and outgoing, is enveloped and kept confidential according to HIPAA standards. Demonstrates patience, kindness, and cooperation with clients and co workers. May be asked to work at or travel to any Sanford Laboratories site depending on the needs of the facility and at the discretion of the supervisor manager. When students are providing patient care, treatment, and or services as a part of their training, any all employees may be asked to supervise the students. Required Skills Computer and organizational skills. When applicable, the employee must have a current valid driver s license, and must meet all medical guidelines.

item.title: (USA-HI-Honolulu) Driver
item.description:
GET YOUR GO ON!
IT’S EXCITING being on the fast track to career success.
If you're looking for a career with a company that is as high energy as you are, join the Avis Budget Group (Nasdaq: CAR) team. We operate two of the leading global brands in the vehicle rental industry through Avis and Budget. Along with our subsidiaries and licensees, we provide a complete range of vehicle rental services through 10,000 rental locations in three operating regions: North America; Europe, Middle East & Africa (EMEA); and Latin America/Asia-Pacific. That means we're serving customers in approximately 175 countries around the world. We're headquartered in Parsippany, N.J. and own and operate most Avis and Budget car rental offices in North America, Europe and Australia, and operate primarily through licensees in other parts of the world. As a Customer Led, Service Driven organization, our approximately 28,000 employees are empowered to make decisions and move things forward.
In our Driver position you will transport vehicles to and from locations safely. You will assist associates in maintaining smooth and safe traffic flow throughout check in area and conduct the final inspection of all Avis Budget vehicles to ensure readiness for customer rental. Essential duties and responsibilities will vary.
In order to be considered for this outstanding opportunity you must have driving experience, excellent communications skills and be willing to work shifts that may include evenings, weekends, and holidays.
DRIVER REQUIREMENTS:
* Must be 18 years of age or older * High school diploma or equivalent or preferred * Must have 6 months of prior work experience * Physical ability to move in and out of vehicles * Effective verbal communication skills to communicate with customers, co-workers and management * Driving experience with a valid Drivers License (as mandated by state and location) and a good driving history * Must be willing to work outdoors in all types of weather conditions * Ability to work various shifts including weekends, evenings, and holidays on a part time basis
Avis Budget Group is an EEO/AA Employer
The information listed above is intended to describe the general nature and level of this position. Essential functions and responsibilities may change as business needs require. Your response to this advertisement may result in your consideration for employment with an affiliated company of Avis Budget Group, the publicly traded parent company of Avis Budget Car Rental, LLC and its subsidiaries. Offers of employment will be made by Avis Budget Car Rental, LLC or any of its employing companies or brands, including Avis, Budget, Budget Truck or AB Car Rental Services. Candidates must meet all basic qualifications and submit a complete application to be considered for this position. This posting serves as an advertisement of an existing open position only and does not qualify as the job description.
Employee Type: Full Time
Required Experience: 0-1 Years
Category: Transportation
Career Level: Experienced (Non-Manager)
Required Education: High School/GED
City: Honolulu State: Hawaii Zip Code: 96815 Country: USA

item.title: (USA-CA-San Francisco) Vehicle Return Associate
item.description:
Are you driven to help people?
Are you looking to accelerate your career into the fast lane?
Then Avis Budget Group is the place for you!
Our goal is to provide "Best in Class" customer care and to foster life-long customer relationships. That is why we strive to make every customer experience one that leaves a lasting impression. We handle each customer interaction with the utmost professionalism, courtesy and responsiveness.
Your passion for helping customers with their needs - whether it is directing customers as they return their rental car ensuring a smooth and safe traffic flow, assisting customers remove their valuables from the rental vehicle, expediting the conclusion of their vehicle rental experience or simply helping them feel valued while they wait - makes you an important part of our Avis Budget Group Team.
In this position, you would work outdoors, for your entire work shift, greeting customers as they return their rental car to our lot. If you are motivated and dependable with a proven track record of success in a customer care environment, then we can put your career on the map.
To begin, you will need the following:
* High school diploma * At least 1 year of prior Customer Service experience * Good communication skills * Flexibility - Due to the nature of our business, this role will require you to work flexible schedules including nights, weekends, overnights and holidays that may frequently change so flexibility is a must! * Willingness to learn and help others * Motivation and dependability
We provide you:
* Competitive pay * Medical, Dental, Vision & 401K * Full training to learn the business and enhance your professional skills * Paid vacations, car rental discounts & much more!
If you are motivated and dependable with a proven track record of success in a customer care environment, then we can put your career on the map.
A valid drivers license is required for all positions. Drug screening and a background check are a part of our hiring process.
Avis Budget Group is an EEO/AA Employer

Apply that understanding in developing outbound marketing strategies for commercial products.?Research competitive products and maintain current competitive information.Experience-Qualifications?5-7+ years related marketing experience, preferably with commercial products.?2+ years of experience managing marketing teams ?Candidates must have experience working with products sold through wholesale distribution channels (reps and dealers)?Ideal candidate has worked with products in the food service, restaurant or hospitality industries?Experience managing projects with multiple departments and stakeholders?4-year college degree in Marketing, Business, Communications or related field.?Creativity and strong written and verbal communications skills.?Ability to attend to multiple projects and deadlines, and work with others within the company to successfully complete projects?Competence in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)At its core, Blendtec is innovation. With our greatest satisfaction coming from embracing new ideas, improving upon old ones, and, ultimately, making even better blenders. If you want to make a direct impact on company success... Provides input on staffing ratios and deployment. * Provides oncoming Shift and supervisors with accurate and complete resident status report. Maintains the 24 hour report book. * Develops work assignments for RNs, LPN-LVNs and Nurse Aides as directed. * Supervises, directs and evaluates staff (i.e., RNs, LPN-LVNs, Medicate Aides-Medication Techs, Nurses Aides, etc.) as directed. Participates in counseling, disciplinary action and termination of staff to the extent permitted by state practice act. * Assures compliance with policies and procedures. * Reports problems and complaints timely in the Nurse Manager. * Provides feedback to Nurse Managers regarding performance of RNs, LPN-LVNs and Nurse Aides. * Participates in hiring and selection of RNs, LPN-LVNs and Nurse Aides * Gives feedback and participates in performance appraisals as assigned. * Supervises nursing assignment, which includes directing assigned nursing staff to the extent permitted by state practice act. * Coordinates and performs admission, transfer and discharge or residents. * Completes all appropriate assessments relative to the resident's status. * Maintains positive working relationships between nursing and other departments. * Actively supports the Angel Care Program. * Services on and participates in committees as assigned. * Assures that inventory and supplies are maintained in a clean and safe manner on the unit, are utilized economically and communicates need for housekeeping, maintenance or nutritional services assistance. * Supports and participates in the center's Performance Improvement initiatives. * Participates in Survey readiness per SMART Manual * Completes records and reports as needed.

item.title: (USA-UT-SALT LAKE CITY) SECTION 8 HOUSING SPECIALIST I
item.description: The Section 8 Housing Specialist supports the mission of the Housting Authority by providing assisted rental services and case management to low-income individuals and families in Salt Lake County, Salt Lake City and West Valley areas. This is done by following HUD regulations, Housing Authority policies and procedures, by working with other Housing Authority personnel to coordinate essential agency functions, and with various community agencies and partnerships.High school graduate or equivalent required. Two years job related experience. Type 50 wpm. Refer website www.hacsl.org for complete job description and application form.

item.title: (USA-UT-SAINT GEORGE) Production Line Assistant -Sg
item.description: Production Line Assistant -Sg (Req.#: 1570 ) Job Type: Manufacturing Job Location: St. George, UTThe maker of Blue Bunny Ice Cream is now seeking full-time production workers in our St. George, Utah facility for day and night shifts. We are looking for team-oriented people who pride themselves on hard work and dedication. Employees must be quality conscious and capable of producing high quality dairy products. We need people who enjoy physical work, are capable of working as part of a team, and can maintain accuracy while working in a demanding environment. Applicants must be at least 18 years of age, have a high school diploma or GED, have a good work history, can perform the functions of manufacturing work, and can communicate with other co-workers in relation to working safely. In exchange, we offer a very competitive salary and hourly night shift premium. A post offer pre-employment background check and drug screen is required. **Due to the large number of applications received, only those who fit the qualifications will be contacted. No phone calls, emails, or onsite visits, please.*** EOE, Females and Minorities are encouraged to apply.

item.title: (USA-UT-LAYTON) Solutions Provider (Sales)-- Layton
item.description: 1. Provide quality customer service to include assistance with purchases, suggestive selling and providing product information.2. Build and maintain an understanding of the stores products and price information to assist with customer purchases.3. Receive payments from customers, effectively run company accounting software, operate credit card machine and return appropriate change as needed.4. Unload deliveries to include lifting and carrying boxes and stocking in appropriate areas.5. Maintain a neat and orderly store at all times to include dusting and vacuuming.6. Prepare product displays as requested.7. Report any theft or suspected theft by customers or employees to management immediately.8. Perform other related duties as assigned.

item.title: (USA-UT-AMERICAN FORK) Dump Truck Driver
item.description: Applicant will become part of a team. Applicant will be asked to be versatile in the trucks driven, experience with pups and transport trailers a plus. Applicant will be dispatched to deliver aggregate and or equipment throughout Utah and Salt Lake Counties. Applicant will deal with general public daily. Experience in construction and excavation a plus. Willing to train the right person.

item.title: (USA-UT-MOAB) Quality Control Technician
item.description: The Synergy Company is currently seeking a Quality Control Technician. The company, located in the breathtaking surroundings of Moab, UT, is a manufacturer and direct-to-consumer retailer of premium quality, organic dietary supplements, serving the most discerning consumers in all parts of the world. The selected candidate will report to the Quality Control Manager. Responsibilities and duties include, but are not limited to the items that follow: Ensure that product quality is maintained within existing specifications throughout various stages of the production process by sampling, testing and auditing; documenting and reporting findings, maintaining records, filing and data entry. The candidate must pay attention to detail, analyze and solve problems, and multitask. The candidate is required to communicate information verbally and in writing. The chosen individual must be at least 18 years old per company policy and have high school diploma or GED. Computer experience is required along with basic math skills. The position requires frequent lifting throughout the day of up to 75 lbs. Since its inception over 20 years ago, The Synergy Company has grown in stature to become one of the most highly regarded brands of certified organic supplements in the international marketplace. Financially stable and consistently profitable, the company is currently undergoing a period of sustained growth as it expands the offerings and reach of its branded product line. The Synergy Company cares about the environment and the communities it serves. Recognized twice by the State of Utah for "Excellence in Manufacturing for Environmental Consciousness" the company is frequently cited as a leading example of sustainable business practices. As well, the company is deeply committed to supporting the local community of Moab. Most importantly, The Synergy Company cares about its employees, offering excellent benefits, competitive wages, internal promotion opportunities, and flexibility for life's occurrences. We consider every employee and customer as a member of the Synergy Family and treat each with respect, integrity and the opportunity to better themselves, not only in their career but in regard to their physical well being.
